            BIODIVERSITY AND PRTECTED AREAS,TF021160-EC METAP-PROTECTION OF COASTAL LAGOONS,TF028357-GEF1-EPPG TUNISIA BIODIVERSITY

abstracts.cdata!:
The Protected Areas Management Project
            aims to improve the management of three national parks:
            Ichkeul, Bouhedma, and Jbil, for the purposes of conserving
            biodiversity of global importance and contributing to the
            overall improvement in welfare of local populations. The
            project's approach to biodiversity conservation is
            based on community participation. The participatory approach
            will be carried out through the coordination with national,
            governorate, and local level institutions. Some of the
            project components may trigger the Bank's policy on
            involuntary resettlement, which also includes specific
            provision for the loss of access to natural resources in
            parks and protected areas. To achieve its objectives of
            biodiversity conservation, the project may require the
            restriction of access to the resources in the defined core
            areas that are currently utilized by the population. The
            Park Management Team (PMT) for each protected area will be
            the main executors of the process framework. During the
            project implementation, when conflicting views concerning
            the utilization of resources arise, the Development
            Committee and PMT will be the forum for dispute resolution.
            If no acceptable solutions can be reached, claims will be
            presented to the Local Development Council. Should conflicts
            still remain, the claims will be settled by the Regional
            Development Council. The execution of the process framework
            will be monitored by the Project Management Unit.
